# LlmAgent

Core agent class for creating LLM-powered agents

## Overview

LlmAgent is a core component of the Google Agent Development Kit (ADK). This documentation covers:

- Basic usage patterns
- Advanced configuration options
- Best practices and examples
- Common troubleshooting scenarios

## Key Features

- Production-ready implementation
- Seamless integration with other ADK components
- Comprehensive error handling
- Performance optimizations

## Usage Examples

```python
# Example implementation
from google.adk.agents import LlmAgent
from google.adk.tools import llmagent

# Basic usage pattern
agent = LlmAgent(
    name="example_agent",
    model="gemini-2.5-flash",
    description="Example agent using LlmAgent",
    instruction="You are an example agent demonstrating LlmAgent",
    tools=[llmagent]
)
```

## Best Practices

1. Always follow ADK naming conventions
2. Include comprehensive tool docstrings
3. Handle errors gracefully
4. Use appropriate tool selection logic
5. Test thoroughly before deployment

## Related Components

- Works with other ADK tools and agents
- Integrates with Vertex AI and Cloud Run
- Supports state management and callbacks
- Compatible with multi-agent workflows

## Troubleshooting

Common issues and solutions:
- Configuration problems
- Integration challenges
- Performance concerns
- Deployment issues

For more information, see the complete ADK documentation.
